intro: Lastrea janeirensis, commonly known as the Janeirensis Lastrea, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, which includes many succulent species adapted to arid environments. The plant is characterized by its fleshy, water-storing leaves and small, star-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of yellow and white. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires minimal water, making it suitable for xeriscaping. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
